channel.title: crypto on calamaridude
channel.description: Recent content in crypto on calamaridude

item.title: Passchecker Writeup
item.description: from vsCTF # We were given passchecker2000.py def validate(password: str) -> bool: if len(password) != 49: return False key = ['vs'.join(str(randint(7, 9)) for _ in range(ord(i))) + 'vs' for i in password[::-2]] gate = [118, 140, 231, 176, 205, 480, 308, 872, 702, 820, 1034, 1176, 1339, 1232, 1605, 1792, 782, 810, 1197, 880, 924, 1694, 2185, 2208, 2775] if [randint(a, b[0]) for a, b in enumerate(zip(gate, key), 1) if len(b[1]) !

item.title: Huge Writeup
item.description: from imaginaryCTF # Setup # Challenge consists of a challenge file and an output file Output file includes RSA values c (cipher text), n (modulus), and e (exponent) In order to decrypt a file encrypted with an RSA encryption, according to wikipedia, one must solve the following equation: (c^d)modn n and c are given but we don’t know d d can be found by solving this equation: de=1mod(lambda(n))
